summary: Email correspondence between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the West Palm Beach Regional Office regarding arrangements to review and scan documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators for use in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of prosecution by the SDNY team mentioned in the email.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators; documents from that investigation are being sought.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the context of the prior SDFL investigation, and the SDNY is prosecuting Maxwell.

events.title: Coordination call for document review
events.description: SDNY prosecutors schedule a call with the West Palm Beach office to arrange review and scanning of Epstein investigation documents.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and seeks documents from the prior Southern District of Florida (SDFL) investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

Documents and case files from the SDFL Epstein investigation, including materials gathered for an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) inquiry, are stored in a secure room in the West Palm Beach office.
An inventory of the materials exists, and during a prior OPR visit, a dedicated scanner was used to send documents directly to DOJ accounts.
The correspondence shows inter-district coordination within the DOJ to gather evidence for the Maxwell prosecution.
